item.title: .NET Application Developer (concord / pleasant hill / martinez)
item.description:
Skills: .NET Framework, VB and C# Development in .NET, ASP.NET, Microsoft UI Automation, SQL Server 2005, technical documentation

Location: Concord, CA

Term: Part-Time Contract; can move into Full-Time Permanent or Full-Time Contract

Description:
Are you experienced creating and maintaining software applications using .NET Framework (both VB and C#), ASP.NET, Microsoft UI Automation, and SQL Server 2005?

If so, HealthCare Information Management, Inc. (HCIM) can offer you a career as an Application Developer in the healthcare/managed care industry.

HCIM is well versed in the complexities and characteristics of todays health care delivery systems, with an intuitive eye on those to come. With boundless skills and industry knowledge, we build solutions that address todays pressing issues while preparing clients to meet tomorrows challenges.

HCIM strives to create an environment built on trust, which fosters creative thinking, empowered decision-making, and innovative solutions. Our products and services are recognized to provide the best value based on demonstrated experience, knowledge, and expertise in the healthcare marketplace.

Position Title:
We are seeking an Applications Developer. The ideal candidate will be a self-starter with a high sense of professionalism, and will require minimal supervision.

As an Application Developer, your expertise and work efforts will focus primarily on the development and support of proprietary SymKey® software products used in our client community. Additionally, this position may support HCIMs proprietary products: Appeals Manager, Kwik Actions, ScanClaims Product Suite, and more. As a developer, you will be working both independently and in a development team to maintain and enhance existing client applications and to develop new applications. You would also be writing technical documentation, primarily utilizing Microsoft Word and Visio.

Typical job duties and responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
** Developing in .NET Framework 3.0/3.5 / Visual Studio 2005 client user interfaces, coding with both VB and C#
** Maintaining and enhancing existing .NET/SQL Server 2005 applications
** Automating applications using Microsoft UI Automation and other .NET automation objects
** Developing and maintaining SQL Server 2005 Stored Procedures
** Using Microsoft Word for technical documentation development and Visio for technical drawing
** Using company-standard applications to maintain best business practices
** Working independently and as part of a team to develop, test, debug, and support HCIMs applications

Office Based Position with some Telecommuting:
The Application Developer will work in our Concord, CA development office, with the possibility of some telecommuting. The Application Developer will work closely with the current development team and will also work independently. Residence in or near the greater Concord, CA/San Francisco, CA/Bay Area is a must.

Education Requirements:
* Bachelors degree in computer science/programming or relevant and practical managed care/claims core transaction system development and programming experience.
* Microsoft .NET Certification
* Continuing certification courses in .NET
* Continuing education courses in Visual Studio, SQL Server, and/or other development tools

Minimum Qualifications:
** 3 years or more experience developing.NET client applications
** 2 years or more experience with Microsoft Office and Visio
** 1 year or more experience with Microsoft UI Automation
** Ability to create database structures in SQL Server 2005
** Ability to write stored procedures in SQL Server
** Ability to write complex queries, views and joins
** Crystal Reports and/or SQL Reporting Services development experience a plus
** Healthcare experience is very desirable
** Experience with Facets, QNXT, EZ-CAP or other managed care claims core transaction systems is a plus


* Candidates must have a verifiable work history.
* Candidates must submit to and pass a background check.
* This is NOT a 1099 engagement.
* No agencies please.

Please send your resume, salary history and salary requirements to jobs@hcim.com.


HealthCare Information Management, Inc.
Web: http://www.hcim.com
